item.title: My opinion on courtney love just changed forever
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Not X A Alex, post:17, topic:408066”][quote author=Niall link=topic=509350.msg3736206#msg3736206 date=1314988190]

but so what? i mean these half-wit musicians go into this business for the money, sign shitty contracts and complain about getting fucked over.

they sign the shitty contracts because that’s the only contracts available to them, get big first then we’ll talk

[quote author=Not X A Alex link=topic=509350.msg3736133#msg3736133 date=1314982677]alot of people would like to get paid fucking 2% of 175m, thats 350k. you can live off that without having to go to college or bust your ass off at fucking whatever for 12 hours just to feed your family.
[/quote]

that’s assuming they get big in the first place, I would be surprised if most artists get even half of that several albums in

and $350k is nothing, sure it’s a lot of money for a relatively small amount of work but the point is that most artists do have to go through college and work the full time jobs until they start getting that kind of money
[/quote]
All i have to say is stick with a real job then. if there not in singing for anything else, then do something that is guaranteed money. i don’t really see what the fuss is about, its there decision to get into music, so why bitch about it? sure there are flaws in the music industry, there are flaws in everything. and what do you mean? 350k is a great amount of money, i’m projecting to only be making 55-60 grand a year. i would much rather be blessed to sing for 350k.[/quote]1% make that kind of money btw.

The vast majority of artists have to PAY to tour.

Read full topic
item.source: My opinion on courtney love just changed forever

item.title: My opinion on courtney love just changed forever
item.dc:creator: @Not_X_A_Alex Not X A Alex
item.description:
@Not_X_A_Alex wrote:

Niall:

[quote author=Not X A Alex link=topic=509350.msg3736133#msg3736133 date=1314982677]but so what? i mean these half-wit musicians go into this business for the money, sign shitty contracts and complain about getting fucked over.

they sign the shitty contracts because that’s the only contracts available to them, get big first then we’ll talk

[quote author=Not X A Alex link=topic=509350.msg3736133#msg3736133 date=1314982677]alot of people would like to get paid fucking 2% of 175m, thats 350k. you can live off that without having to go to college or bust your ass off at fucking whatever for 12 hours just to feed your family.
[/quote]

that’s assuming they get big in the first place, I would be surprised if most artists get even half of that several albums in

and $350k is nothing, sure it’s a lot of money for a relatively small amount of work but the point is that most artists do have to go through college and work the full time jobs until they start getting that kind of money[/quote]
All i have to say is stick with a real job then. if there not in singing for anything else, then do something that is guaranteed money. i don’t really see what the fuss is about, its there decision to get into music, so why bitch about it? sure there are flaws in the music industry, there are flaws in everything. and what do you mean? 350k is a great amount of money, i’m projecting to only be making 55-60 grand a year. i would much rather be blessed to sing for 350k.

Read full topic

item.title: My opinion on courtney love just changed forever
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

i agree with the author, so true. I’d rather not fund music companies and instead give money to the actual artist, take C418 for exampe (guy who did minecraft music) his albums come in a pay what you want format, I bought one off his site for about £6 which i thought was fairly reasonable seeing as how it was majoritively a gamble, and he’ll keep all of that minus the paypal fees, and I love the album and have no regrets about buying it

Read full topic
